body_html: @soumith I'll have a look again more closely and let you know. Since I'm coming from torch I intuitively might have thought that model.forward(x) might have been the natural thing to do. On a second note now I'm thinking that this might explain the different results that I've got using pytorch against keras on the same model with the exact same data. Pytorch got me ~94.x% while keras gave me ~97.x%

body: @soumith I'll have a look again more closely and let you know. Since I'm coming from torch I intuitively might have thought that `model.forward(x)` might have been the natural thing to do. On a second note now I'm thinking that this might explain the different results that I've got using pytorch against keras on the same model with the exact same data. Pytorch got me ~94.x% while keras gave me ~97.x%
